title: LINGARA: Cognitive & Linguistic Accessibility with AI
summary: 1.3B people face cognitive barriers to essential info, causing exclusion and inequality. Cognitive accessibility is key for true global, inclusive Web3 and Cardano adoption.
solution: LINGARA leverages advanced Open Source AI with certified scientific methods to adapt texts in real-time for 15 cognitive profiles, helping organizations comply with global accessibility standards

sub_fields.title: Describe what makes your idea innovative compared to what has been previously launched in the market (whether by you or others).
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
**Existing Solutions \(and Why They Fall Short\)**

Solution	Limitations

Generic Simplification Tools (Rewordify, Hemingway)

❌ Do not consider cognitive profiles

❌ Lose critical information

❌ Lack scientific foundation

Screen Readers (JAWS, NVDA)

❌ Only convert text to audio

❌ Do not adapt language

Manual Translation

❌ Expensive (€50–200/page)

❌ Slow (non-scalable)

❌ Inconsistent

Generic AI (ChatGPT, Claude)

❌ Unoptimized prompts

❌ No validation

❌ Proprietary

**Our Solution: LINGARA**

LINGARA combines advanced artificial intelligence (DeepSeek and Claude) with a certified scientific methodology to adapt complex texts in real time for 15 specific cognitive profiles.

**15 Cognitive Profiles**

Profile	Characteristics

1	Initial Technical Comprehension: Basic education, clear without extreme simplification

2	Children & Young Teens (7–12)	: Simple vocabulary, everyday examples

3	Older Adults (70+): 	Familiar vocabulary, no anglicisms

4	Autism Level 1:	Literal language, no metaphors

5	ASD Level 2: 	Clear, predictable structure

6	ASD Level 3: 	Maximum simplicity, short sentences

7	High Abilities: 	Intellectual rigor preserved

8	ADHD / DDA	: Clear structure, straight to the point

9	CAPD (Central Auditory Processing Disorder): 	Short sentences, minimal overload

10	Intellectual Disability: 	Basic vocabulary, concrete examples

11	Twice-Exceptional: 	Intellectual rigor + adaptations

12	Anxiety: 	Calm tone, non-alarming

13	Dyslexia: 	Short sentences, simple words

14	Sensory Hypersensitivity:	Reduced sensory overload

15	Mild Cognitive Decline:	Familiar vocabulary, unhurried pace

**Scientific Quality Guarantees**

100% preservation of critical information – DIP Metric ≥ 90%

Objective readability validation – FRE (0–100), FKGL (0–25)

Compliance with international standards – ISO 24495-1:2023, EAA, WCAG 2.2

Certified scientific methodology – 120 academic references

**Technical Differentiators**

Open Source (MIT License) – All code publicly available on GitHub

Privacy by Design – No registration, no data collection

Cardano Integration – ADA payments, DIDs, NFTs, smart contracts

Automated Validation – 12 real-time quality checks

Retry + Fallback – 3 DeepSeek attempts, fallback to Claude (99.9% uptime)

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
**LINGARA is the world’s first open\-source platform for cognitive and linguistic accessibility powered by AI\.**

We adapt  content (laws, civil rights, health, education, Web3) for 15 distinct cognitive profiles, making critical information accessible to 1.3 billion people globally.

Unique Global Differentiator:

**LINGARA is the only solution that combines:**

**Certified Scientific Methodology** – 120 academic references, ISO 24495-1:2023, European Accessibility Act, WCAG 2.2 AAA

**15 Specific Cognitive Profiles** – Not generic simplification

**100% Critical Information Preservation** – Validated with objective metrics (FRE, FKGL, DIP, NLP, Coh-Metrix)

**Cardano Blockchain Integration** – Transparency, traceability, decentralized identity

**Cost Reduction for Companies, Universities, and Governments** - Over 98% savings through automation in content adaptation and accessibility.

**Guaranteed Free Access for End Users \(Individuals\)** - Understanding information is a Human Right.

**Support During Beta Phase** - English, Spanish, and Portuguese (2026); French, Italian, and German (2027).

**Created by Neurodivergent Professionals:**

This project is developed by neurodivergent social entrepreneurs and professionals (twice-exceptional, autistic spectrum, dyslexia), ensuring self-determination (“Nothing About Us Without Us”).



**Open Source License:**

MIT License — maximum freedom for use, modification, and distribution.

**Privacy by Design:**

No mandatory registration. No personal data collection. Full compliance with GDPR, EAA, WCAG 2.2, and Plain Language standards.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
**Added Value to the Cardano Ecosystem**



LINGARA makes Cardano:



**More Inclusive** – 1.3 billion people can use Cardano

**More Competitive** – The only blockchain with native cognitive accessibility

**More Compliant** – Cardano businesses can meet EAA, WCAG 2.2, ISO 24495-1 standards

**More Adopted** – Removes the language barrier for mass adoption

**More Social**– Aligned with Cardano’s social mission (measurable impact)



Unique Use Cases on Cardano:

✅ Adaptation of Cardano technical documentation for beginners

✅ Smart contracts in accessible language

✅ Catalyst proposals adapted for neurodivergent users

✅ Scientific whitepapers in 15 cognitive profiles



**Social and Scientific Impact**

Measurable Social Impact

Transformative Use Cases



**_Public Defender’s Office_**

Problem: 80% of assisted individuals do not understand laws

Solution: Adaptation of Civil, Criminal, and Labor Codes for 15 cognitive profiles

Impact: 50,000 people/year gain real access to justice



**_University Hospital_**

Problem: Certain neurodivergent patient profiles do not understand consent forms

Solution: Adaptation of medical terms, leaflets, and instructions

Impact: Patient safety and medical autonomy



**_Inclusive School_**

Problem: Generic teaching materials exclude neurodivergent students

Solution: Adaptation of books, exams, and instructions for 15 cognitive profiles

Impact: 40% reduction in school dropout rates



**Open Data:**

✅ Dataset of 5,000 adaptations (anonymized)

✅ Optimized prompts (open source)

✅ Validation metrics (public)

✅ Full source code (MIT License)



**Alignment with SDGs \(Sustainable Development Goals\)**

**SDG	LINGARA Contribution**



SDG 4 (Quality Education)	Accessible teaching materials for neurodivergent learners

SDG 10 (Reduced Inequalities)	Inclusion of 1.3 billion previously excluded individuals

SDG 16 (Peace, Justice, and Strong Institutions)	Universal access to laws and civil rights



**_Neurodivergent Empowerment_**

_"Nothing About Us Without Us"_

✅ Neurodivergent team – 50% of core members

✅ Participatory co-design – 3 workshops with beneficiaries

✅ Peer validation – Neurodivergents validate adaptations

✅ DAO governance – Collective on-chain decision-making

✅ 60% revenue to NGOs – Social reinvestment

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
Proven Validation:



Unlike theoretical proposals, [https://lingara\.pro/](https://lingara.pro/) is already in beta testing (semi-automatic solution with human review), with real validated cases, including:



- [https://edpresearch\.info/](https://edpresearch.info/) (USC – University of Southern California) — 5 cognitive profiles adapted
- [https://www\.prisma\.events/](https://www.prisma.events/)  (Web3 incubator) — 15 cognitive profiles adapted
- [https://www\.unesco\.org/sdg4education2030/en](https://www.unesco.org/sdg4education2030/en) UNESCO Youth Declaration — 15 cognitive profiles adapted



These tests demonstrate confirmed technical and scientific feasibility.



Expected Impact (6 months):



- 5,000 unique users (free, no mandatory registration)
- 15 paying corporate clients (recurring revenue in ADA)
- 5,000 adaptations generated
- 1 scientific publication in an indexed journal
- 20 partner NGOs validating social impact
- 2,500+ on-chain transactions (ADA payments, DIDs, NFTs, smart contracts)

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
Acceptance Criteria

2.1 ✅ 99.5% uptime

2.2 ✅ NPS ≥ 40

2.3 ✅ 3 contracts audited

2.4 ✅ DIP ≥ 90%, FRE/FKGL validated

2.5 ✅ 10 workshops completed

2.6 ✅ 5 guides published

**Validated Scientific Metrics**

LINGARA uses three complementary scientific metrics to ensure adaptation quality:

**Flesch Reading Ease \(FRE\)**

Definition: Readability metric developed by Rudolf Flesch, scoring reading ease on a scale of 0–100.

Formula: FRE = 206.835 – 1.015 × (words/sentences) – 84.6 × (syllables/words)

Recent Validation (2015–2025):

Jindal et al. (2017): Analysis of 249 health information studies

Will et al. (2025, JMIR): LLMs improve readability while maintaining accuracy

Alamleh et al. (2025): FRE suitable for AI-generated content

**Flesch\-Kincaid Grade Level \(FKGL\)**

Definition: Metric developed by J. Peter Kincaid et al. estimating the U.S. school grade level required to understand text.

Formula: FKGL = 0.39 × (words/sentences) + 11.8 × (syllables/words) – 15.59

Scientific Basis: Developed for the U.S. Navy to assess technical manual readability; 0.90 correlation with reader comprehension

Recent Validation (2015–2025):

Stanford University (2024): LLMs improve formulaic readability measures in K–12 curricula

Risch et al. (2025): Validated in cancer education materials

Prykhodchenko et al. (2025): Adapting Flesch formulas to Ukrainian

**Information Density Preservation \(DIP\)**

Definition: Measures preservation of information during adaptation.

Formula: DIP = (Preserved Information / Original Information) × 100%

Scientific Basis: Based on Relevance Theory (Sperber & Wilson, 1986) and text simplification research (Siddharthan, 2014). Ensures essential information is not distorted or omitted.

Application: LINGARA validates DIP ≥ target for each profile (87–99%). If DIP < target, adaptation is rejected and LLM retries.

sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
Aceptance Criteria 



✅ 2,000+ mainnet transactions

✅ 50% of revenue in ADA

✅ 5,000 total adaptations

✅ 20 documented use cases

✅ Submitted for peer review

✅ 20 votes conducted



Concrete Example:



A company needs to demonstrate compliance with the **EAA \(European Accessibility Act\) to avoid fines of up to €10 million\. **[https://commission\.europa\.eu/strategy\-and\-policy/policies/justice\-and\-fundamental\-rights/disability/union\-equality\-strategy\-rights\-persons\-disabilities\-2021\-2030/european\-accessibility\-act\_en\#products\-and\-services\-covered](https://commission.europa.eu/strategy-and-policy/policies/justice-and-fundamental-rights/disability/union-equality-strategy-rights-persons-disabilities-2021-2030/european-accessibility-act_en#products-and-services-covered)



With LINGARA:



✅ Content is adapted for 15 cognitive profiles

✅ Receives an on-chain certification NFT (immutable)

✅ Auditors verify compliance via blockchain (transparent)

✅ Company can legally prove compliance (admissible in court)



Without blockchain: a PDF certificate can be falsified and is not accepted as legal evidence.

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
LINGARA offers an unprecedented combination of features that distinguish it from competitors and bring concrete advantages to the Cardano ecosystem. Unlike other solutions that rely on generic simplification, LINGARA adapts content for 15 specific cognitive profiles, making complex information accessible to a much broader audience.



Its methodology is grounded in robust scientific research, referencing 120 academic sources, while most competitors lack scientific validation. LINGARA ensures 100% preservation of critical information (DIP ≥ 90%), whereas other tools often lose essential content during adaptation.



The platform integrates natively with the Cardano blockchain, providing transparency, traceability, and verifiable proof of compliance—features absent in competing solutions. This enables:



Legal and regulatory compliance for Cardano-based organizations (e.g., EAA, WCAG 2.2).



Immutable certification of accessibility adaptations via NFTs.



On-chain verification of impact and usage metrics.



Decentralized identity management (DIDs) for users and organizations.



Additionally, LINGARA is fully open source (MIT License), giving the community freedom to use, modify, and contribute to the project. Privacy by design ensures no personal data is collected, aligning with Cardano’s ethos of security and user sovereignty.



For the Cardano community, this translates into:



Greater inclusivity – enabling 1.3 billion people globally to access Cardano content.



Enhanced adoption – removing cognitive and linguistic barriers for mass usage.



Stronger ecosystem credibility – providing legally verifiable accessibility solutions.



Alignment with Cardano’s social mission – measurable social impact via blockchain transparency.



This unique combination of cognitive accessibility, scientific rigor, blockchain integration, open-source availability, and privacy by design positions LINGARA as a strategic asset for the Cardano ecosystem.

sub_fields.title: I confirm that evidence of prior research, whitepaper, design, or proof-of-concept is provided.
sub_fields.description: Foundational Work:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the proposal includes ecosystem research and uses the findings to either (a) justify its uniqueness over existing solutions or (b) demonstrate the value of its novel approach.
sub_fields.description: Ecosystem Value Proposition:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the proposal demonstrates technical capability via verifiable in-house talent or a confirmed development partner (GitHub, LinkedIn, portfolio, etc.)
sub_fields.description: Builder Credentials:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the proposer and all team members are in good standing with prior Catalyst projects.
sub_fields.description: Catalyst Standing:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the proposal clearly defines the problem and the value of the on-chain utility.
sub_fields.description: Problem & Use Case:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the primary goal of the proposal is a working prototype deployed on at least a Cardano testnet.
sub_fields.description: Tangible Prototype:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the proposal outlines a credible and clear technical plan and architecture.
sub_fields.description: Technical Approach:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the budget and timeline (≤ 12 months) are realistic for the proposed work.
sub_fields.description: Realistic Scope:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the proposal includes a community engagement and feedback plan to amplify prototype adoption with the Cardano ecosystem.
sub_fields.description: Community Engagement:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the budget is for future development only; excludes retroactive funding, incentives, giveaways, re-granting, or sub-treasuries.
sub_fields.description: Budget Compliance:
